wild_animals.survival_guide: Squirrel monkeys are not typically dangerous to humans. Maintain a respectful distance when observing them.

wild_animals.name: Madagascar cat
wild_animals.survival_guide: They are not typically dangerous to humans, it is important to exercise caution when encountering them in the wild.

wild_animals.name: indri
wild_animals.survival_guide: Indris are not typically dangerous to humans. Maintain a respectful distance when observing them.

wild_animals.name: Indian elephant
wild_animals.survival_guide: Indian elephants are wild animals and can be dangerous if provoked. Do not approach or attempt to interact with them in the wild.

wild_animals.name: African elephant
wild_animals.survival_guide: African elephants are wild animals and can be dangerous if provoked. Do not approach or attempt to interact with them in the wild.

wild_animals.name: lesser panda
wild_animals.survival_guide: Lesser pandas, also known as red pandas, are not typically dangerous to humans. Approach them calmly to observe without causing stress.

wild_animals.name: giant panda
wild_animals.survival_guide: Giant pandas are not typically dangerous to humans. Approach them calmly to observe without causing stress.

wild_animals.name: barracouta
wild_animals.survival_guide: Barracouta is a type of fish. If fishing, be cautious when handling sharp-toothed fish and use appropriate gear.

wild_animals.name: eel
wild_animals.survival_guide: Eels are not typically dangerous to humans. Be cautious when handling them to avoid bites.

wild_animals.name: coho
wild_animals.survival_guide: Coho salmon is a type of fish. If fishing, follow local regulations and be cautious when handling fish.

wild_animals.name: rock beauty
wild_animals.survival_guide: Rock beauty is a type of angelfish. If snorkeling or diving, be cautious around marine life and avoid touching or disturbing them.

wild_animals.name: anemone fish
wild_animals.survival_guide: Anemone fish are not typically dangerous to humans. Be cautious when snorkeling or diving and avoid touching or disturbing them.

wild_animals.name: sturgeon
wild_animals.survival_guide: Sturgeon is a type of fish. If fishing, be cautious when handling fish and use appropriate gear.

wild_animals.name: gar
wild_animals.survival_guide: Gars are not typically dangerous to humans. Be cautious when fishing and handling fish.

wild_animals.name: lionfish
wild_animals.survival_guide: Lionfish have venomous spines that can deliver a painful sting. If you encounter a lionfish while diving or snorkeling, do not touch or approach them. Maintain a safe distance and alert others in your group. If stung, seek medical attention immediately.

wild_animals.name: puffer
wild_animals.survival_guide: Pufferfish contain a potent neurotoxin called tetrodotoxin, especially in their internal organs. Never attempt to catch or prepare pufferfish without proper training and certification. Consuming improperly prepared pufferfish can be lethal. It is recommended to avoid handling or consuming pufferfish unless you are an expert in their safe preparation.
